RT @TVNBR: LIVE: President Dilma Rousseff addresses the opening of the first #Ministerial Meeting. See on @TVNBR http://t.co/p3mX3NujNU
My first recommendation to you (ministers) is to work hard to follow up the political project that is changing Brazil.
Changing for much better, because we have less poverty, more opportunities, more equality, more rights and more and more democracy.
I made it clear in the campaign that my new mandate would have as its main objective the preparation of Brazil for the knowledge age (...)
(...) with absolute priority for investments in education, generators + and better opportunities for Brazilian and Brazilian.
The adjustments we are making are necessary to maintain the course, expand opportunities, and preserve the social and economic priorities of the gov
The measures that we are taking and q we will take will consolidate and expand a winning project at the polls for four consecutive elections (...)
(...) and that these measures are helping to transform Brazil. #Ministerial Meeting
The changes that the country expects and needs for the next 4 years depend greatly on the stability and credibility of the economy.
We need to ensure soundness in our economic indicators. #Ministerial Meeting
We are facing the need to promote a fiscal rebalancing, to recover the growth of the economy as quickly as possible (...)
(...) creating conditions for the fall of inflation and interest rate in the medium term. #Ministerial Meeting
And thus guaranteeing the continuity of employment and income generation. #Ministerial Meeting
We take some measures that are corrective in nature, that is, they are structural measures that are necessary in all circumstances.
These new conditions show that in the last 12 years 20.6 million formal jobs have been generated. #Ministerial Meeting
The social security taxpayer base was increased by 30 million beneficiaries. #Ministerial Meeting
The real value of the minimum wage, which is the basis of the entire social protection system, has grown more than 70%. #Ministerial Meeting
In addition, the life expectancy of Brazilians w / 40 years of age increased, from 73.5 p / 78.5 years, that is, almost 5 years to + life
In these cases, it is not about fiscal measures, it is about improving social policies to increase their effectiveness, efficiency and justice
Another set of measures is of an eminently fiscal nature, indispensable for the financial health of the Brazilian State.
Accurate public accounts are needed to control inflation, economic growth and the sustained guarantee of employment and income.
We will promote fiscal rebalancing gradually. #Ministerial Meeting
Brazil continues to be a continental and diversified economy, with a large internal market, ec / companies and versatile workers (...)
(...) and empowered to seize the opportunities before us. #Ministerial Meeting
Today we are the 7th largest producer and exporter of agricultural products, the 3rd largest producer and exporter of ores (...)
(...) the 5th most attractive foreign investment, the 7th in accumulation of foreign exchange reserves and the 3rd largest internet user.
Brazil continues to be a country with great investment opportunities. #Ministerial Meeting
Álvaro Omar Franco Chacón is sworn in as Superintendent of Tax Administration http://t.co/b8YkLXY4Pp
Brazil continues to be a country with solid institutions, with stable rules, a free and democratic society. #Ministerial Meeting
In 2016, the eyes of the world will once again be directed towards Brazil, with the realization of the Olympics. #Ministerial Meeting
Once again, as in the World Cup, we are going to show the organization capacity of Brazilians, now in one of the most beautiful cities in the world, our Rio.
We must face ignorance, disinformation always and permanently. I will repeat: always and permanently.
We can not allow the fake version to be created. #Ministerial Meeting
When it is said that we will end with the historic achievements of the workers, answer loud and clear: IT IS NOT TRUE!
Labor rights are untouchable, and it will not be our government, a workers' government, that will repeal them. #Ministerial Meeting
When the question of urban mobility arises, speak of the R $ 143 billion that we are investing in 118 large and medium-sized municipalities.
On the water crisis, remember that since the beginning of this q is the greatest drought of the last decades, the federal government supported and is supporting (...)
(...) including large investments, the demands of the state gov, constitutional responsible for water supply.
The people voted for us because they believe we are the best people to do what it takes for Brazil to advance further.
Our people voted for us because they believe in our ability and our honesty of purpose. #Ministerial Meeting
We defend a great national pact against corruption that involves all spheres of government, all power centers (...)
(...) in both the public and private environments. We will be even more ruthless with the corrupt and corrupt. #Ministerial Meeting
Brazilians and Brazilians expect us to behave in a healthy way. #Ministerial Meeting
We will be, on each of the days of this new mandate, public managers absolutely committed to austerity and probity.
We will honor each citizen with an exemplary management, q executes quickly and efficiently policies that will keep Brazil in the path of development.
There is also a great expectation of Brazilian society, and we all know this by the Political Reform.
We will place the debate on this issue with society as a priority in this first semester. #Ministerial Meeting
I hope from each of the ministers and ministers much dialogue with the Congress, with governors, with the mayors, and with the social movements ...
We must seek, through dialogue and negotiation, to establish the consensus and the paths that will produce the changes that Brazil needs.
Only in this way will we build + development and equality. #Ministerial Meeting
I expect a lot of dedication, cooperation between the ministries and a lot of work. I wish lots of luck and a lot of success to everyone.
